intro: Hemitelia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese hemitelia, is a climbing plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Hemitelia guianensis is often found in the understory of dense forests, where it relies on other plants for support.
